lom:description.lom:string:
"Computer Science touches and transforms every aspect of our lives. Traditional industries and sciences rely more and more upon computer science, driving the rapid innovations we see in medicine, technology, communications, physical sciences, commerce, and human relationships.
The Department of Computer Sciences offers both a Bachelor of Arts and a Bachelor of Science in Computer Sciences.
Academic Overview
* The Bachelor of Science is more science-oriented (17 additional science hours, made up of computer sciences, mathematics, calculus-based physics, and a secondary science sequence). * The Bachelor of Arts is better suited in combination with other degrees, majors, or special programs (such as pre-medical, pre-dental, or pre-allied health preparations). * Elective hours may be used to explore one area in greater depth or to peruse many different academic areas (approximately 21 hours on the BA; 17 hours on the BS). "ps.

lom:title.lom:string: Undergraduate Computer Science Curriculum - UT Austin
